p: Considering that the zoonotic SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV originated from bats and jumped between intermediate hosts (civets and camels, respectively), SeACoV may pose a similar risk to human health through transmission from pigs or other potential intermediate hosts ( Yang et al., 2019b). The zoonotic potential of SeACoV was assessed in vitro, showing that SeACoV was able to grow efficiently in nine human and monkey cell lines. As a conserved receptor across different animal species for SeACoV cell entry has been proposed, SeACoV may pose a similar risk to human health through interspecies transmission from pigs in the future ( Fig. 4 ).
